result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Latrevion LD Bester

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Latrevion LD Bester in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Latrevion LD Bester.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a calendar call and a plea hearing. Defense requested a plea and sentencing hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Latrevion LD Bester not in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Latrevion LD Bester.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporters available. Case scheduled for status conference. Defendant failing to appear. Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date. Court adjourns case for calendar call and projected guilty plea, Branch 15 room 632 Courthouse.
Calendar call scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Latrevion LD Bester in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Latrevion LD Bester appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture.  
Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge  Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Latrevion LD Bester in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Latrevion LD Bester not in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/8/22 @ 1p
